isis.stitle: SUSPENSION ALIGNMENT - REAR AXLE ADJUSTMENT - REYCO 101A

svcproc.title: REYCO 101A
svcproc.para: Adjustment of the axle location for alignment purposes on the Reyco 101 suspension is accomplished by means of eccentric bushings located at torque leaf mounting eyes.

step1.para: Equalize dimensions "P" and "D" in alignment procedure ( Figure 12) by loosening torque leaf bolt nuts enough to free rubber bushings in castings. Mark adjusting bolt, washer and front hanger with chalk or paint ( Figure 16). This provides a means of visually identifying eccentric bushing movement.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. MARK BOLT HEAD, WASHER AND FRONT HANGER WITH CHALK OR PAINT

step1.para: To adjust, place a crescent wrench on torque leaf bolt and turn bolt in the opposite direction of desired axle movement. Maximum adjustment is 7/16 inch on each side of axle.
After adjustment is made, tighten torque leaf bolt nuts to specified torque and recheck alignment dimensions on forward rear axle. Refer to TORQUE CHART, for specifications.

Equalize the difference of dimensions from side to side in alignment procedure ( Figure 14) by loosening torque leaf bolt nut at equalizer bracket enough to free rubber bushings in castings. Mark adjusting bolt, washer and equalizer bracket with chalk or paint ( Figure 17). This provides a means of visually identifying eccentric bushing movement.

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. MARK BOLT HEAD, WASHER AND BRACKET WITH CHALK OR PAINT

step1.para: To adjust, place a crescent wrench on torque leaf bolt and turn bolt in the opposite direction of desired axle movement. Maximum adjustment is 7/16 inch on each side of axle.
After adjustment is made, tighten torque leaf bolt nuts to specified torque and recheck alignment dimension on rear rear axle. Refer to TORQUE CHART, for specifications.
